meta.dc:title: Public Law 119–20: Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Environmental Protection Agency relating to “Review of Final Rule Reclassification of Major Sources as Area Sources Under Section 112 of the Clean Air Act”.
meta.dc:creator: National Archives and Records Administration
Office of the Federal Register
meta.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

longTitle.officialTitle:
Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Environmental Protection Agency relating to “Review of Final Rule Reclassification of Major Sources as Area Sources Under Section 112 of the Clean Air Act”.
June 20, 2025
[S.J. Res. 31]

resolvingClause.i: Resolved by the Senate and House of Representatives of the United States of America in Congress assembled,

section.content: That Congress disapproves the rule submitted by the Environmental Protection Agency relating to “Review of Final Rule Reclassification of Major Sources as Area Sources Under Section 112 of the Clean Air Act” (89 Fed. Reg. 73293 (September 10, 2024)), and such rule shall have no force or effect.

note.heading: CONGRESSIONAL RECORD, Vol. 171 (2025):
note.p: Apr. 30, May 1, considered and passed Senate.
